# parameters

**Instance Property**

A dictionary of additional parameters to include with the action.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor var parameters: [AnyHashable : Any] { get }
```

## Discussion

Use this dictionary to specify any behavior-specific data for the action. For example, the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIUserNotificationActionBehavior/textInput] behavior supports the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIUserNotificationTextInputActionButtonTitleKey] key, which lets you customize the title of the button displayed by the text input interface.

## Getting the action’s configuration

- **activationMode**: The mode in which to run the app when the action is performed.
- **isAuthenticationRequired**: A Boolean value indicating whether the user must unlock the device before the action is performed.
- **isDestructive**: A Boolean value indicating whether the action is destructive.
- **behavior**: The custom behavior (if any) that the action supports.
